author: Melissa Korn
title: Some Students Face Consequences to Walk Out
text:
Some of the of students who walked out of school Wednesday faced unexcused absences or more serious penalties, as school districts in a number of states cracked down on demonstrations aimed at pressuring politicians to toughen gun laws.
Cobb County School District in Georgia, which has nearly 113,000 students, said Wednesday that those who participate in disruptive demonstrations may be subject to punishment in accordance with the student code of conduct. This could range from administrative meetings to a five-day suspension,...
